JUDGES: Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in Bjelovar . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , an advocate practising in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant was a shareholder of the GPE banka d.d . , a joint - stock company incorporated under NORP law with its registered office in GPE ( “ the bank ” ) . The bank was entirely owned by private individuals and companies .

On DATE ORG DATE “ the ORG ” ) adopted a decision appointing a temporary administrator to the bank . Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , from the date of service of such decision , all powers of the management board , the supervisory board and the ORG general meeting were transferred to the temporary administrator . Subsequently , on DATE the ORG extended the temporary administrator ’s term of office for DATE .
Meanwhile , on DATE the ORG had proposed to the Government that the process of recovery and restructuring of the bank be commenced , as provided for by the domestic legislation .

In accordance with that proposal , on DATE the Government adopted the Decision on Recovery and Restructuring of the GPE banka d.d . ( “ the Decision ” ) . From that date , all shares held by the bank ’s shareholders were revoked and cancelled . Following the process of recovery , the bank was to issue new shares , all in the name of ORG for Securing Savings Deposits and ORG ( PERSON agencija za osiguranja štednih uloga i sanaciju banaka ) .

In DATE and DATE CARDINAL shareholders of the bank , but not the applicant , filed CARDINAL separate petitions for review of the constitutionality and legality ( prijedlog za ocjenu ustavnosti i zakonitosti ) of ORG Decision of DATE . They complained that the Decision violated their constitutional rights as shareholders of the bank . They also claimed that the bank had been in good standing and that the ORG had therefore been unnecessary .
On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) discontinued the proceedings because the statute on which the ORG was based had in the meantime been repealed .

On DATE the applicant brought a civil action for unjust enrichment ( or enrichment without cause ) in ORG ( PERSON u GPE ) against the bank , seeking repayment of CARDINAL NORP kunas ( HRK ) . He relied on section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW . The applicant explained that on DATE he had bought CARDINAL of the bank ’s ordinary shares for the above amount . However , on the basis of ORG Decision of DATE he had been deprived of those shares . He argued that the ORG had actually annulled the contract under which the bank had sold him its shares . That contract , being the cause on the basis of which he had paid HRK CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the bank , had thus ceased to exist . It followed that the bank had enriched itself without cause , or more precisely , on the basis of a cause which had subsequently ceased to exist , and had therefore been bound to return to him the sum in question .

On DATE ORG dismissed his action . It rejected the applicant ’s argument that ORG LAW DATE had annulled the contract under which he had acquired the bank ’s shares . Consequently , the court found that the cause on the basis of which he had paid HRK CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the bank had not ceased to exist and that the bank had not been bound to return the sum demanded .

Following an appeal by the applicant , on DATE ORG ( PERSON u GPE ) quashed the first - instance judgment on account of incomplete facts and remitted the case . It also instructed the lower court to verify whether the contract under which the applicant had bought the shares could be rescinded under LAW on account of the fundamental change in circumstances , having regard to ORG Decision of DATE .

In the resumed proceedings , on DATE ORG ruled for the applicant , finding that the bank had indeed enriched itself without cause . The court again did not accept the applicant ’s argument that the contract of sale on the basis of which he had bought the bank ’s shares had been annulled by ORG of DATE . It however held that , because of that ORG , the contract had lost one of the essential elements for the validity of every contract , namely its consideration , defined as the economic purpose of a transaction . Relying on section CARDINAL of LAW , the court further found that , owing to the absence of consideration , the contract was null and void . Accordingly , the nullity of the contract had resulted in the disappearance of the cause on the basis of which the applicant had paid the bank the sum sought and the bank had been obliged to return that sum to him .

Following an appeal by the respondent , on DATE ORG reversed the first - instance judgment and dismissed the applicant ’s action . It found that ORG LAW DATE had not annulled the applicant ’s contract with the bank relating to the purchase of the shares . Moreover , the ORG could not in any other way have affected the validity of that contract because the parties had performed , and thereby extinguished , their contractual obligations before the LAW had been adopted ( the applicant by paying HRK CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the bank , and the bank by transferring CARDINAL of its shares to him ) . It followed that at the relevant time ( during its existence ) the applicant ’s contractual obligation had been performed for consideration which could not subsequently have been removed by an event that took place after that obligation had already been extinguished . The contract in question had thus been valid . As that contract had been the cause on the basis of which the applicant had paid HRK CARDINAL to the bank , and had been valid , it could not be argued that this cause had ceased to exist and that the bank had been bound to repay him the amount sought . The conditions for rescission of the contract on the basis of a fundamental change in circumstances had not been met either , because under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW such rescission could not have been sought by a party who had already performed his or her contractual obligations .
On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint against the second - instance judgment , alleging breaches of ORG CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) , DATE and CARDINAL of the LAW .
On DATE ORG dismissed his constitutional complaint .

The relevant provisions of LAW ORG , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE ( consolidated text ) , DATE , DATE ( consolidated text ) , CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( consolidated text ) , CARDINAL ( corrigendum ) ) provide as follows :
“ The right to property is guaranteed . ”
“ The rights acquired through the investment of capital shall not be diminished by law , or by any other legal act . ”
“ CARDINAL . Property [ rights ] may be restricted or taken in accordance with the law and in the interest of GPE upon payment of compensation equal to its market value .
CARDINAL . The exercise ... of property rights may exceptionally be restricted by law for the protection of the interests and security of GPE , nature , the environment or health . ”
The relevant provisions of LAW ( Zakon o bankama , ORG no . PERSON ) read as follows :

“ When ORG establishes that the potential losses of a bank ... are higher than that bank ’s share capital and in cases where a bank is insolvent , it shall appoint a temporary administrator to that bank , or shall file a petition with the competent court with a view to opening bankruptcy proceedings against that bank . ”

“ From the date of service of the decision on the appointment of a temporary administrator , all powers of the management board , supervisory board and ORG general meeting shall cease and shall at the same time be transferred to the temporary administrator . ”

“ On the proposal of ORG , the Government of GPE may decide to commence the process of recovery of a bank if it establishes that this is in the ORG ’s special interest and if it finds that the other possibilities of preventing disturbance in the stability of the overall financial system of the ORG have been exhausted . ”
The relevant provisions of the Act on Recovery and Restructuring of Banks ( Zakon o sanaciji i restrukturiranju banaka , ORG no . DATE “ the Recovery and Restructuring Act ” ) read as follows :

“ The procedure of recovery and restructuring of a bank shall be initiated when a bank shows potential losses ... of PERCENT of the amount of its share capital , if ORG deems such procedure feasible and economically justifiable . ”
“ The decision on recovery and restructuring of a bank shall be given by ORG on the proposal of ORG . ”
The Recovery and Restructuring Act was repealed on DATE by the entry into force of LAW o prestanku važenja zakona o sanaciji i restrukturiranju banaka , ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ) .

The Decision on Recovery and Restructuring of the GPE banka d.d . ( ORG o sanaciji i restrukturiranju GPE banke d.d . , GPE , ORG nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL – “ the Decision ” ) , in its relevant part , read as follows :
“ It is established that on DATE the bank has :
( a ) risky investments and potential liabilities in the amount of CARDINAL kunas , including potential losses of CARDINAL kunas ;
( b ) suspected and disputed claims ... in the amount of CARDINAL kunas ;
( c ) business losses incurred in DATE and DATE and DATE in the amount of CARDINAL kunas . ”

“ On DATE of the publication of this Decision all existing shares of the ORG shall be revoked and cancelled . The ORG shall issue new shares in the amount of MONEY kunas , which shall be entirely owned by the ORG . ”
The relevant part of LAW ( Zakon o sudovima , ORG nos . CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) , as in force at the material time , read as follows :
Commercial courts ... shall adjudicate :
CARDINAL . ...

CARDINAL . Disputes concerning the establishment , operation and dissolution of commercial companies as well as disputes concerning disposition of membership and membership rights in such companies ... ”
The relevant part of LAW ( Zakon obveznim odnosima , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) , read as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Every contractual obligation shall have permissible consideration .
( CARDINAL ) Consideration shall be impermissible if it is contrary to the LAW , peremptory rules or public morals .
( CARDINAL ) It shall be assumed that an obligation has consideration even if it is not expressly stated . ”
“ If consideration is inexistent or impermissible , the contract shall be null and void . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) If , after a contract has been entered into , circumstances occur which make the performance of the obligations of CARDINAL party more difficult , or if , owing to such circumstances the purpose of the contract can not be attained , and in both cases to the extent that the contract obviously no longer corresponds to the expectations of the contracting parties and that , according to general opinion , it would be unfair to maintain the contract as it is , the party for which performance has been rendered more difficult or the party which , owing to the [ fundamentally ] changed circumstances , can not attain the purpose of the contract , may request that the contract be rescinded .
( CARDINAL ) ...

( CARDINAL ) The party requesting the rescission of the contract can not rely on [ fundamentally ] changed circumstances which have occurred after the expiry of the time - limit set forth for the performance of his or her obligation .
( CARDINAL ) ...
ENRICHMENT WITHOUT CAUSE

“ ( CARDINAL ) When a part of the property of CARDINAL person passes , by any means , into the property of another person , and that transfer has no basis in a legal transaction or a statute [ i.e. it is without cause ] , the beneficiary shall be bound to return that property . If restitution is not possible , he or she shall be bound to provide compensation for the value of the benefit received .
( CARDINAL ) ...

( CARDINAL ) The obligation to return the property or provide compensation for its value shall arise even when something is received on account of a cause which did not come into existence or which subsequently ceased to exist . ”

On DATE the High Commercial Court ( ORG trgovački sud PERSON ) delivered judgment no . Pž-CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL in a case where the plaintiff , a shareholder of the GPE banka d.d . , had sued the bank and ORG for Securing Savings Deposits and ORG before the competent commercial court claiming that she had been deprived of her shares and the rights derived from them without any compensation . She sought a declaratory judgment that she was still a shareholder of the bank and asked the court to order the respondents to transfer her back CARDINAL of her shares . In ruling for the plaintiff the High Commercial Court directly applied Articles CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and DATE ( CARDINAL ) of the LAW . It expressly stated that ORG Decision of DATE was contrary to the latter Article and reasoned as follows :

“ In particular , any restriction or deprivation of the rights deriving from shares would be contrary to that provision of the LAW , as it would constitute diminution or deprivation of membership rights acquired through the investment of capital in a joint - stock company . ”
